urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK’s Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.

tweets.text:
Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd spoke to @MLiebreich about the Environment Agency and the UK’s current climate agenda.

Listen to the full podcast here: https://t.co/nz2m1WtYdk

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/oZkN7xe5s4

We’re carrying out work on crest & access track at Kenwith Valley flood storage reservoir above Bideford starting next Wednesday The reservoir stores floodwater, protecting 500 properties in the town The crest will be closed to public access while we re-level crest & repair track https://t.co/nbGyCWBnuZ

We’re looking for two new members to join the #Thames Regional Flood and Coastal Committee – an exciting opportunity to play a role in managing #floodrisk across the South East. More info: https://t.co/8GoRLZ3YjT
 
@EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE @vandenoort @TE2100Plan

The Flimby flood protection scheme is due to start in spring and includes a detention basin in a farmers field and construction of additional dams to slow the flow in woodland to the east of Flimby. #NFM #Slowtheflow #flimby @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC 

https://t.co/BhNEZqjYDH

As part of our action plan to address the global climate emergency, we're adapting our estate and vehicle fleet to use renewable energy and reduce carbon emissions.

Our environment champion Bruce explains more 👇

Find out about our #EA2025 action plan: https://t.co/s1QHtz69OU https://t.co/Rb6gEgZ94h

urls.title: Our virtual farm visits
urls.description: Farm visits are an opportunity for farmers to tell us about the issues they are facing and to make clear the realities of farming. Due to COVID-19, physical farm visits stopped. The experience was too valuable to abandon, so we created virtual farm visits instead.

tweets.text: A new post on our blog about how we're doing virtual farm visits in lockdown, including a lovely video of some virtual farm tours: https://t.co/6rhbAbr99L featuring @hanslope @PerkinsLodge @farmingGeorge @greg_colebrook - thank you so much all for brilliant virtual tours! :)

Kingfishers need to eat their own bodyweight in fish & aquatic insects each day. Our #StaffsSUNRISE work on the Trent & its tributaries is improving habitat for fish and insects - helping the kingfisher enjoy an abundant diet! Filmed at Milton by @TalesofaWildGuy 
@EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/MzxiykaHUb
@KarenShackleto5 Well done Karen. Its amazing how many people up and down the country are becoming one voice for our rivers.

I'm asking South Cambs residents to send me their photos of our run-down waterways to let @EnvAgency know that, despite the wet weather, our waterways are in crisis!. 

Please, have a dig through your phones & social media for any pictures to highlight our water shortages! https://t.co/I0qiugKdYv

Our Field Team have been busy in #Leyland today removing this big tree from the River Lostock!

urls.title: Simulating spatially coherent widespread flood events across the UK (Webinar) -
urls.description: UK Climate Resilience Programme Webinar Series 2021 24 February 2021 Speakers: Paul Sayers (Sayers and Partners); stakeholder response from Mike Steel Chair: Jason Lowe Register for the webinar Abstract CAT modelling was developed in the late 1980s to capture the spatial correlation of extreme events, with event footprints being used to demonstrate how an extreme […]

Wednesday 24 Feb, 12-1pm

Register: https://t.co/2Xvbfl6mHq https://t.co/GjvM40D2D9

urls.title: Fostering Prosperity: driving innovation and creating market opportunities through environmental regulations
urls.description: Join us on 2 March 2021 at 9.30am - 11am for the launch of Aldersgate Group’s latest report, Fostering Prosperity, which focuses on how environmental regulation can accelerate business innovation, create new market opportunities, and promote job creation. The UK has set commendable objectives on the climate and environmental agenda. In addition to its target to produce net zero emissions by 2050, the UK is committed to overturning the decline in the natural environment within a generation, improving the

tweets.text: Join us and experts from @burohappold @EnvAgency @suez @SMMT @WillmottDixon @Nestle on Tuesday 2 March as we launch “Fostering Prosperity” a report exploring how good regulation can drive #innovation and help us achieve #netzero ambitions. RSVP here: https://t.co/5qO4TzHkaG https://t.co/Ih6kKFAXgC
